comments:
My scenario is this:  I have a security manager installed.  There are also
URLStreamHandlers registered (via the URLStreamHandlerService mechanism).

With this setup, I am seeing security exceptions whenver application constructs
a URL object using one of the registered protocols.  A stack is below.  It seems
to me that the URLStreamHandlerProxy knows that its going to "get" the service
and could wrap this in a doPrivileged block.

java.security.AccessControlException: access denied
(org.osgi.framework.ServicePermission
org.osgi.service.url.URLStreamHandlerService get)
		 at
java.security.AccessControlContext.checkPermission(AccessControlContext.java(Compiled
Code))
		 at
java.security.AccessController.checkPermission(AccessController.java(Compiled Code))
		 at java.lang.SecurityManager.checkPermission(SecurityManager.java(Compiled Code))
		 at
com.ibm.ws.security.core.SecurityManager.checkPermission(SecurityManager.java(Compiled
Code))
		 at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.checkGetServicePermission(Framework.java:1307)
		 at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.getService(BundleContextImpl.java:877)
		 at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.protocol.URLStreamHandlerProxy.<init>(URLStreamHandlerProxy.java:61)
doPriv here?
		 at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.protocol.StreamHandlerFactory.createURLStreamHandler(StreamHandlerFactory.java:108)
		 at java.net.URL.getURLStreamHandler(URL.java:1038)
		 at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java(Compiled Code))
		 at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java(Compiled Code))
		 at java.net.URL.<init>(URL.java:411)
		 at com.acme.foo.Bar (Bar.java:69)  e.g. URL url = new
URL("acme://this/is/a/test");
                 ...
A fix has been released in HEAD.
